1.text: After this, Job opened his mouth and cursed his day,

2.text: and this is what he said:

3.text: May the day perish on which I was born, and the night, in which it was said, “A man has been conceived.”

4.text: May that day be turned into darkness, may God not seek it from above, and may light not illuminate it.

5.text: Let darkness and the shadow of death obscure it, let a fog overtake it, and let it be enveloped in bitterness.

6.text: Let a whirlwind of darkness take hold of that night, let it not be counted in the days of the year, nor numbered in the months.

7.text: May that night be alone and unworthy of praise.

8.text: May they curse it, who curse the day, who are prepared to awaken a leviathan.

9.text: Let the stars be concealed with its darkness. Let it expect light, and not see it, nor the rising of the dawn in the East.

10.text: For it did not close the doors of the womb that bore me, nor take away evils from my eyes.

11.text: Why did I not die in the womb? Having left the womb, why did I not immediately perish?

12.text: Why was I received upon the knees? Why was I suckled at the breasts?

13.text: For by now, I should have been sleeping silently, and taking rest in my sleep

14.text: with the kings and consuls of the earth, who build themselves solitudes,

15.text: either with princes, who possess gold and fill their houses with silver,

16.text: or, like a hidden miscarriage, I should not have continued, just like those who, being conceived, have not seen the light.

17.text: There the impious cease from rebellion, and there the wearied in strength take rest.

18.text: And at such times, having been bound together without difficulty, they have not heard the voice of the bailiff.

19.text: The small and great are there, and the servant is free from his master.

20.text: Why is light given to the miserable, and life to those who are in bitterness of soul,

21.text: who expect death, and it does not arrive, like those who dig for treasure

22.text: and who rejoice greatly when they have found the grave,

23.text: to a man whose way is hidden and whom God has surrounded with darkness?

24.text: Before I eat, I sigh; and like overflowing waters, so is my howl,

25.text: for the terror that I feared has happened to me, and so has the dread befallen me.

26.text: Have I not remained hidden? Have I not kept silence? Have I not remained calm? Yet indignation has overcome me.
